intro: Euphrasia hirtella proles sebastianii, commonly known as the Sebastian's hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has hairy leaves that help it retain moisture. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for eye conditions.
